website_summaries.verdict: Huge ramp for those who need a long and wide surface for larger dirt bikes, but it's expensive.
pros: Gives you a 10-foot ramp with 17.25 inches of width, so its coverage area is extremely large
With a 10-foot length, the angle of the ramp will be shallower, making it easier to push the dirt bike up the ramp
Maximum weight capacity support of 1,500 pounds

customer_reviews.title: Study Well Made and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Got my pair of the 10' 4 beam wide ramps today and I have to say i'm impressed. Quality of workmanship is top notch and they are STURDY! much heavier than expected and they look great. The Load up on level ground into my 4x4 F150 was easy as cake. I took a video ove it below.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Driggs

customer_reviews.title: Structural support was not welded at the hinge
customer_reviews.text: Rudimentary quality control at the factory should have caught this defect. Welds on one side of the ramp hinge were good. The hinge side that failed was tacked only in two small spots. I walked up the ramp and it failed. I weigh 221 pounds. I consider this a major safety defect. If I had been riding my motorcycle up that ramp it could have failed leading to severe injury and major property damage. Titan's customer service advised I would have to contact Amazon and seemed unconcerned. I am less than impressed and will now wait for Titan to do the right thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beside my truck, my favorite vacation "tool"
customer_reviews.text: I ended up buying this one and two 12" wide ones so that I can ride my Harley into my truck and have a place for my feet. I also bought two U-bolts to hold them together when loading/unloading. I have used them about 15 times now with no problems. They rode next to my bike for over 5000 miles this summer and allowed me to ride in 7 states. Takes me about 15 mins. to set-up and unload my bike (by myself). Have a friend with you the first few times, as there is still a slight "pucker factor" at first. I'm 57 and I feel comfortable with the process.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: No complaints, fast shipping. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I really dont have any complaints. I have the 8' bed with a bed tool box and it fits with the tailgate shut, more than I can for my Harley. Lol Makes loading and unloading much more manageable and confident. I like the product quality, shipping was extremely fast which most time large items take a while. Easy, pre-asswmbled. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great ramp. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: It was just as advertised. I use it to load my Honda Africa Twin in the back of my full size 4x4 truck. A shorter ramp is just to steep of an angle. My bike weights 540lbs. which was no issue for the ramp. I used a wood box to step on while loading the motorcycle. I am thinking of ordering a thinner ramp so that I can walk next the bike while loading. I like that the ramp folds in half and fits in the back of my 6' truck bed.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty, Light Weight
customer_reviews.text: I use these to load my Exmark Radius E 52" Z turn with the baggers on and my 6'6 380 # self on the seat into my dump trailer since my factory ramps were too short and the mower's hitch dragged on the concrete from the steep angle. No problem. Fold up easy. Totally worth the money.
